plugins.name: Gradientify
plugins.description:
Bring vibrant, layered gradients into your Figma designs. With this plugin, you can:


  1. Generate random gradients with an optional noise effect
  2. Paste CSS code from gradientify.app to apply gradients to layers
  3. Use gradients as fill properties for easy customization


Free trial

Try it out up to 5 times in each mode (random generation and CSS import), or unlock unlimited use with a license key.


Thank you for your support

This plugin was built to complement gradientify.app, a free tool for designing and animating gradients for the web. Buying a license helps keep the project going ‚ù§Ô∏è


Contact me:

If you have questions or comments, please send me a message to rengifo.eder@gmail.com

plugins.name: Detach variables
plugins.description:
Detacher ‚Äì Take Full Control Over Figma Variables

Tired of wasting time manually detaching variables in Figma?

Detacher is your all-in-one utility to scan, preview, and detach variables from your selection ‚Äî quickly, cleanly, and confidently.


‚úÖ What Makes Detacher Better?


üîç Visual Variable Summary

Get an instant snapshot of all the variables in your selection ‚Äî Colors, Text, Numbers, Others ‚Äî with live counts for total clarity.


üéØ Smart Selection Control

Choose exactly what to detach using simple checkboxes:

‚úî Colors

‚úî Text

‚úî Numbers

‚úî Others


üÖ∞Ô∏è Full Typography Support

Detach all typography-related variables ‚Äî including mixed styles and both string- and number-based properties


‚öôÔ∏è How It Works

  1. Select your frame, group, or section in Figma.
  2. Launch the Detacher plugin.
  3. Pick the variable types you want to detach.
  4. (Optional) Preview changes.
  5. Hit Detach Variables ‚Üí Done.


üë©‚Äçüíª Who Is Detacher For?

  1. Figma Power Users who want deeper control over variables.
  2. Design Engineers & Dev Designers looking to streamline their cleanup workflows.
  3. DesignOps & UI Librarians maintaining clean, scalable systems.
  4. Hackathon Designers & Makers who work fast and need instant variable resets.
  5. Anyone tired of manually detaching variables one by one.


üå± Support the Creator


Built for the community ‚Äî shaped by your feedback.

We‚Äôre constantly testing edge cases and adding features, but bugs can happen.

If you find one, reach out and help make Detacher better.

‚ú® More powerful features are already in the works.
plugins.tagline: Detach differnet types of variables in a frame safely and effortlessly  !

plugins.name: Auto Layout Checker
plugins.description:
Auto Layout Checker helps you maintain design consistency by identifying and converting elements that don't use Auto Layout. Perfect for cleaning up designs and ensuring layout consistency across your files.


üîç Key Features:

‚Ä¢ Scan entire pages or selected elements for missing Auto Layout

‚Ä¢ One-click conversion of frames and groups to Auto Layout

‚Ä¢ Clear visual feedback for converted elements

‚Ä¢ Theme-aware interface that matches your Figma theme

‚Ä¢ Quick navigation to elements through direct selection


üéØ Perfect for:

‚Ä¢ Design system cleanup and maintenance

‚Ä¢ Legacy file modernization

‚Ä¢ Team collaboration and consistency checks

‚Ä¢ Quick Auto Layout implementation


üí° How to use:

1. Select elements to scan (or leave unselected to scan entire page)

2. Click "Scan" to find elements without Auto Layout

3. Click any element to navigate to it in your design

4. Use the "Convert" button to instantly apply Auto Layout


The plugin automatically applies sensible Auto Layout defaults:

‚Ä¢ Vertical layout orientation

‚Ä¢ 10px spacing between elements

‚Ä¢ 10px padding on all sides

‚Ä¢ Automatic sizing for both axes


Keep your designs maintainable and responsive with Auto Layout Checker!
plugins.tagline: Quickly find and convert elements missing Auto Layout, streamlining your design system consistency.

Ê≥®ÊÑè‰∫ãÈ°π

  1. ‰ªÖÊîØÊåÅÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑÂõõËæπÂΩ¢Ë∑ØÂæÑÔºåÂ§çÊùÇË∑ØÂæÑÂèØËÉΩÊó†Ê≥ïÊ≠£Á°ÆËß£Êûê„ÄÇ
  2. Âú®‰ΩøÁî®Êèí‰ª∂ÂâçÔºåÂª∫ËÆÆÂ§á‰ªΩÂéüÂßãÂõæÂΩ¢‰ª•Èò≤Ê≠¢Êï∞ÊçÆ‰∏¢Â§±„ÄÇ

  4. Á°Æ‰øù Figma Â∑≤Êõ¥Êñ∞Âà∞ÊúÄÊñ∞ÁâàÊú¨Ôºå‰ª•Ëé∑ÂæóÊúÄ‰Ω≥‰ΩøÁî®‰ΩìÈ™å„ÄÇ


Introduction

Perspective Transform Pro is a powerful Figma plugin designed for designers to effortlessly achieve perspective transformations on vector graphics. With an intuitive interface and flexible controls, you can quickly adjust the four corner points of your graphics to create professional-grade design effects.


Function Description

  1. Real-Time Perspective Adjustment: Manipulate the four corner points to adjust the perspective of vector graphics in real-time.
  2. Precise Control: Based on relative proportions, ensuring accuracy and consistency in transformations.
  3. Automatic Updates: Automatically recalculates and repositions corner points when selecting new graphics.
  4. Reset Functionality: One-click reset to restore graphics to their original state for easy adjustments.
  5. Compatibility with Various Shapes: Supports rectangles and simple quadrilateral vector graphics.


How to Use

  1. Select a rectangle or quadrilateral vector graphic in Figma.
  2. Run the Perspective Transform Pro plugin.
  3. In the plugin interface, drag the four corner points to adjust the perspective effect.
  4. Click the "Reset" button to restore the graphic to its original state.
  5. Observe the graphic in Figma updating in real-time until you achieve the desired design effect.


Precautions

  1. Supports only simple quadrilateral paths; complex paths may not parse correctly.
  2. It is recommended to backup original graphics before using the plugin to prevent data loss.
  3. The current version does not support curved or multi-path vector graphics.
  4. Ensure Figma is updated to the latest version for the best user experience.

plugins.name: Figma to Scabld
plugins.description:
Effortlessly Import Your Figma Designs into Scabld!


Transform your designs into mobile apps in no time with the Scabld plugin for Figma. Seamlessly bring your Figma screens into Scabld and move from design to a fully functional mobile app without any coding required. Our plugin automatically adapts your design to Scabld's no-code platform, so you can focus on turning your vision into reality.


How to use this plugin


1. Install the free Figma plugin.

2. Select your Figma designs.

3. Import them directly into Scabld.

4. Continue editing and customizing just like in Figma.

5. Add interactions and animations.

6. Finalize and publish your mobile app with zero code.


With Scabld, skip the hassle of manual conversions. Simply import your Figma files into our no-code platform and turn them into fully functional mobile apps. We preserve your layer names and design structure, making it easy to pick up where you left off and enhance your creations for a smooth user experience.


Preserve your layer structure.

When you import your designs, all your Figma groups and layer names are kept intact. This allows you to refine, adjust, and polish your app directly in Scabld without losing any important details.


Performance and optimization guaranteed.

When you publish with Scabld, we ensure your mobile app is optimized for peak performance across all devices. Every file is tuned for a fast and smooth experience, providing a high-quality result without compromising speed.


To learn more about Scabld and explore our other features, visit scabld.com.
plugins.tagline: Import your Figma designs into Scabld effortlessly.

plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin allows users to convert Markdown text into fully structured Figma frames automatically, enhancing design workflows and documentation processes.


Function Description

The plugin parses Markdown syntax and creates corresponding Figma frames and text elements, supporting headings, lists, bold text, and horizontal rules. It ensures that all content is visually organized according to Markdown structuring.


Usage Method

Simply input your Markdown text into the provided text area in the plugin‚Äôs UI and click the ‚ÄòConvert Markdown‚Äô button. The formatted content will appear as structured frames within your current Figma file.


Note

Ensure all text is properly formatted in Markdown before conversion. The frame width is fixed at 500px, but the height will adjust according to the content.

plugins.name: Text Harvest
plugins.description:
Text Harvest exports and updates text layers in bulk with a CSV file

Get a quick CSV file from your designs for your copywriting or localization team.


Export

  1. Make a selection or export the entire page if there's no selection
  2. The plugin export only the visible layers, and also ignore the duplicated ones
  3. You'll get a CSV file with layer names and its content
  4. You can skip text layers that you don't want to export by simply adding the symbol "!" at the beginning of the layer name


Update

  1. Make a selection or update the entire page if there's no selection
  2. Select the CSV file
  3. The plugin updates all the layers with the same name


Currently multicolumn CSV are not supported. If you need to translate to different languages, upload an independent CSV for each one
plugins.tagline: Export and updates text layers in bulk with a CSV file

plugins.name: Font Detective
plugins.description:
Ever need to know exactly which fonts are in your project without clicking through dozens of text layers? Manually checking for fonts is slow and easy to miss one, especially in complex files.


Font Detective instantly scans your selection and provides a clean list of every font family it finds.


No more guesswork, no more hunting. ‚ú®


How it works:


  1. Select a frame - Click on a single frame or select multiple frames
  2. Run "Font Detective" - One click and you're done
  3. Get results - Immediately see a complete list of all font families spotted within your selection. It's that simple!


Key Benefits:


  1. Quick Typography Audits - Get a fast and accurate inventory of the fonts in any file or component
  2. Maintain Consistency - Easily spot unwanted fonts that don't belong in your design system
  3. Streamline Cleanup - Use the generated list as a checklist to consolidate your font styles
  4. Effortless Handoff - Quickly provide a list of all used fonts to developers or teammates
  5. Simple & Fast - No complex settings. Just select and run for instant results


Perfect for designers, design teams, and anyone working with typography in Figma! üé®


Feedback is welcome!

accepted.name: Lorenzo Brandimarte
accepted.description: Web and UI Designer | No-code developer

plugins.tagline: Font Detective scans your frame and provides a clean list of every font family it finds.

plugins.name: Screen Counter
plugins.description:
Tired of manually counting screens in your Figma file? Meet Screen Counter, your new best friend for quick and intelligent screen counting!


‚ú® Here‚Äôs what it can do:

  1. Count selected screens in just a click ‚Äì no more eye strain or second guessing.
  2. Add prefixes (like login, home, product) to group screens with similar flows or purposes.
  3. If multiple screens share the same prefix, we‚Äôll count them as 1 (because duh, they‚Äôre basically twins).
  4. If you don‚Äôt add a prefix, we‚Äôll count each screen individually, as they should be!


Simple, clear, and a little smarter than your average screen counter.


üñ±Ô∏è Select ‚Üí Prefix ‚Üí Count ‚Üí Done.


Try it now and turn screen chaos into clean counts!

plugins.name: FrameFlex - Frame Resizer & Scaler
plugins.description:
üîπ FrameFlex ‚Äì Smart Frame Resizing for Figma üéØ

Manually resizing frames can be a nightmare ‚Äî especially when things break.

FrameFlex is a Figma plugin built to help you intelligently scale mobile frames, while preserving structure and layout integrity (when properly set up). ‚ú®


Here‚Äôs what FrameFlex can do:


üîÅ Multi-frame support ‚Äì Resize multiple mobile frames in one action.

üì± Device presets ‚Äì Quickly apply popular mobile screen sizes like iPhone, Android, and more.

üìê Layout-aware resizing ‚Äì Maintains Auto Layout, constraints, and alignment ‚Äî if your design is structured correctly.

üî§ Element scaling ‚Äì Adjusts font size, spacing, strokes, and other properties proportionally.

üéØ Icon/vector protection ‚Äì Prevents scaling on specific elements to avoid distortion.

‚öôÔ∏è Rounding controls ‚Äì Use smart, grid, or exact rounding for clean results.


üí° The more Auto Layout you use, the better the results will be.

FrameFlex works best when your design is clean, consistent, and fully built with Auto Layout in mind.


‚úÖ Focused on mobile-first workflows.

‚ö†Ô∏è Support for other frame types depends on how well they're structured.
plugins.tagline: Resize multiple frames. Preserve structure. Stay consistent.

‚∏ª


Available tools

‚Ä¢Image-to-Prompt ‚Äì upload an image and extract the underlying prompt

‚Ä¢One-Click Copy ‚Äì copy the ready-to-use prompt wherever you need


‚∏ª


Set up your Google Gemini API key in Promptus:


Open Promptus inside Figma.

Click the gear icon (Settings) in the top-right corner of the plugin panel.

Go to Google AI Studio.

Click ‚ÄúSign in to Google AI Studio‚Äù and authenticate with your Google account.

In the top header, click the ‚ÄúGet API Key‚Äù button.

When prompted, click ‚ÄúCreate API key‚Äù.

In the project pop-up, enter a project name (or select an existing one) and confirm.


Thank you for choosing Promptus! ü§©

üëâ If you have any questions or suggestions, let us know ‚Äî your feedback makes all the difference.

plugins.description:
üîç Find lost local automatically catches every local instance whose master component lives in another library / document.

Just set a prefix symbol (default ‚Äú_‚Äù) and choose the search scope‚Äîcurrent page or whole file.


Features

‚Ä¢Any nesting depth ‚Äì detects instances hidden inside local components and their masters.

‚Ä¢Page-level grouping ‚Äì shows how many problematic components each page contains.

‚Ä¢One-click jump ‚Äì selects and zooms to the target instance.

‚Ä¢Custom prefix ‚Äì works with _Tabs, .hidden, -draft, @deprecated, or any symbol you use for local components.


When it helps

‚Ä¢Before publishing a library ‚Äì make sure no stray local copies remain in the file.

‚Ä¢During a design-system migration ‚Äì quickly spot legacy components that still point elsewhere.

‚Ä¢While reviewing external files ‚Äì instantly see what is pulled from external libraries.


How to use

1.Open the plugin and, if needed, change the prefix symbol.

2.Pick Current page or Whole file and click Search.

3.Review the grouped list. Clicking a component name jumps to its first found instance.

4.Items labelled ‚ÄúOutside pages‚Äù exist only inside master components; fix them in the corresponding library.


The plugin works entirely inside Figma‚Äîno internet access required, and no data ever leaves your account.

plugins.tagline: Find all local component instances whose master lives in another file

133089.name: Find lost local ‚Äî ¬´–ù–∞–π—Ç–∏ –ø–æ—Ç–µ—Ä—è–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –ª–æ–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–Ω–µ–Ω—Ç—ã¬ª
133089.description:
üîç Find lost local automatically catches every local instance whose master component lives in another library / document.

Just set a prefix symbol (default ‚Äú_‚Äù) and choose the search scope‚Äîcurrent page or whole file.


Features

‚Ä¢Any nesting depth ‚Äì detects instances hidden inside local components and their masters.

‚Ä¢Page-level grouping ‚Äì shows how many problematic components each page contains.

‚Ä¢One-click jump ‚Äì selects and zooms to the target instance.

‚Ä¢Custom prefix ‚Äì works with _Tabs, .hidden, -draft, @deprecated, or any symbol you use for local components.


When it helps

‚Ä¢Before publishing a library ‚Äì make sure no stray local copies remain in the file.

‚Ä¢During a design-system migration ‚Äì quickly spot legacy components that still point elsewhere.

‚Ä¢While reviewing external files ‚Äì instantly see what is pulled from external libraries.


How to use

1.Open the plugin and, if needed, change the prefix symbol.

2.Pick Current page or Whole file and click Search.

3.Review the grouped list. Clicking a component name jumps to its first found instance.

4.Items labelled ‚ÄúOutside pages‚Äù exist only inside master components; fix them in the corresponding library.


The plugin works entirely inside Figma‚Äîno internet access required, and no data ever leaves your account.

plugins.name: FontMaster - Switch every font in one click
plugins.description:
‚ú® Take control of your typography in Figma ‚Äî instantly.


FontMaster scans your selected frames or artboards and lists every font used in your design. With an intuitive interface, you can preview and replace any or all fonts across your selection in just a few clicks. Whether you're managing design systems or updating brand fonts, FontMaster ensures consistency without the manual hassle.


üõ†Ô∏è How to Use

  1. Run the plugin ‚Äì FontMaster will automatically detect all fonts used in your selection.
  2. Browse detected fonts ‚Äì View a list of all text styles and fonts present.
  3. Choose a new font ‚Äì Pick a replacement font for each one or apply one font to all.
  4. Apply changes ‚Äì Click ‚ÄúApply‚Äù and FontMaster updates everything instantly.


‚úÖ Why Use FontSwap?

  1. Detects all fonts in seconds
  2. Bulk replace fonts with one click
  3. Perfect for design clean-up, brand updates, and system consistency
  4. Saves time on every project

plugins.name: SaveFrame - Save, Share, and Manage Custom Frames with Ease.
plugins.description:
SaveFrame ‚Äî Figma Frames, Re imagined!


Tired of Figma‚Äôs default frame window? SaveFrame is your modern visual command center for everything frames.

Custom frames, Organize, preview, customize, delete, and share‚Äîlike never before.


Whether you're documenting designs, building moodboards, or curating visual systems, SaveFrame gives you full creative control. It's what Figma frames should feel like.


‚ú® Why designers love SaveFrame:


üîç Instant Frame Previews

  1. No more clicking around. See all your frames at a glance in a clean, scrollable UI.

üß© Drag & Drop Organization

  1. Sort, group, and build collections effortlessly. Your canvas, your logic.

üßπ Smart Deletion

  1. Clear out what you don‚Äôt need‚Äîinstantly. Delete single frames or full sets with confidence.

üìê Save All the Details

  1. Dimensions, effects, layout, constraints‚ÄîSaveFrame remembers the stuff that matters.

üé® Reusable Frame Presets

  1. Create your own frame styles and apply them in one click. Keep your design patterns consistent.

üöÄ Seamless Sharing

  1. Export and import frame collections in seconds.
  2. Perfect for sharing with teammates or individuals‚Äîno friction, no confusion.

‚≠ê Favorite Key Frames

  1. Highlight your best work and access it instantly when it counts.

üåó Light & Dark Mode

  1. A workspace that adapts to your vibe, day or night.



üõ† Built for designers who:

  1. Want more control than Figma gives out of the box
  2. Create and manage multiple frames daily
  3. Build moodboards, docs, and design systems
  4. Hate clutter and love visual clarity
  5. Need a fast way to share organized frames with collaborators


In short:

We took the idea of Figma frames and made it flexible, collaborative, and creator-first.

SaveFrame isn‚Äôt just a tool‚Äîit‚Äôs a better way to work with frames.

plugins.name: Export Icon to Compose
plugins.description: Export Icon to Compose is a Figma plugin that lets you export selected vector objects as SVG and instantly convert them into clean, production-ready Jetpack Compose code for Android UIs. It automatically extracts the object's name, dimensions, and processes all <path> elements using the integrated svg-path-parser library. This streamlined workflow saves time, reduces manual coding errors, and improves your design-to-code process.

plugins.name: JSON -> Swatches
plugins.description:
Turn JSON into color swatches in Figma sorted by color.


Each swatch includes the color name (if given) as well as Hex and opacity values.


You can add an optional tag for extra detail if/when importing multiple libraries.


Auditing an existing design system? JSON -> Swatches is a great tool for mapping old color libraries to new.
plugins.tagline: Turn JSON into Color Swatches in Figma

plugins.name: Asterisk
plugins.description:
Asterisk creates a personal knowledge system within your Figma files. Add context to any design element with custom tags, notes, and reference links. Quickly search and navigate to specific elements, making complex files manageable. Created for designers who want to add meaningful annotations to their file with contextual search to maintain clarity and effortless navigation.

plugins.name: GridVar | Quick Column Grid with Variables
plugins.description:
GridVar helps you create width-based column layout grids with linked variables for any frame width. It automatically generates a set of variables representing different column configurations, including gutters, so you can quickly adjust and find the perfect fit for nested layers.


‚ú® Key Features:

‚Ä¢Quick Setup: Easily create layout grids with variable-based configurations.

‚Ä¢Flexible Widths: Effortlessly switch between column setups to match your design needs.

‚Ä¢Time-Saving: Eliminate manual calculations and streamline your workflow.


üìå How It Works:

Generated variables are conveniently stored in the "GridVar" variable collection. You can find the column width variables under: [Grid Name]/Columns.


Perfect for designers looking to simplify layout grid handling and enhance their Figma workflow.
plugins.tagline: GridVar: Width-based Layout Grids with Variables

plugins.name: VarsToDart
plugins.description:
Extract variables from Figma and generate Dart code:


  1. Convert variables into constructor arguments
  2. Define them as class parameters
  3. Generate tooltips for better documentation

plugins.name: howly-figma-plugin
plugins.description:
1. The exported tokens in JSON file follow Design Tokens Properties format.
  2. Each Mode in the Collection exports an independent JSON file.
  3. Collection and Mode names are transformed to kebab-case.
  4. JSON file name follows pattern: {collection-name}.{mode-name}.tokens.json
plugins.tagline: Export design tokens to JSON
